case_vignette: A 2-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his parents for a well-child visit. During his last well-child visit 9 months ago, the patient had not begun talking. The parents report that their son frequently avoids eye contact and has no friends at daycare. He was born at term and has been healthy except for an episode of otitis media 6 months ago, which was treated with amoxicillin. His immunizations are up-to-date. He is at the 95 percentile for height, 20 percentile for weight, and 95 percentile for head circumference. He appears shy. His temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), pulse is 120/min, and blood pressure is 100/55 mm Hg. Examination shows elongated facial features and large ears. The patient does not speak. He does not follow instruction to build a stack of 2 blocks. Throughout the examination, he continually opens and closes his mother's purse and does not maintain eye contact.
question: Which  findings is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Molecular genetic testing showing a mutation in the FMR1 gene.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I frequently avoid eye contact, have no friends at daycare, and do not speak. I also do not follow instructions well, as seen when I couldn't build a stack of 2 blocks.
How old are you?
I am 2 years old.
Do you respond to your name when called?
The vignette does not mention my response to my name being called.
Does the child engage in repetitive movements or have specific routines that they insist on?
Yes, I continually open and close my mother's purse throughout the examination.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: The child, who is 2 years old, often avoids eye contact, lacks friends at daycare, and does not communicate verbally. Additionally, the child struggles with following instructions, as evidenced by the inability to stack two blocks. The vignette does not specify whether the child responds to their name being called. Throughout the examination, the child continually engages in repetitive behavior, frequently opening and closing the mother's purse.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I frequently avoid eye contact and I have not started talking yet. Also, I do not follow instructions well, such as when asked to build a stack of blocks.
How old are you?
I am 2 years old.
Do you engage in repetitive behaviors or have any particular routines or rituals that upset you if they are disrupted?
Yes, I continually open and close my mother's purse.
Do you tend to play with toys in typical ways, such as pushing cars, or do you line them up or focus on parts of the toy?
I do not play with toys in typical ways; during the examination, I didn’t build a stack of 2 blocks when instructed.
Has there been any delay in reaching developmental milestones such as walking or social interaction?
Yes, there has been a delay in social interaction as I have no friends at daycare and I avoid eye contact. Additionally, I had not begun talking by my last well-child visit 9 months ago.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)

trial_4.summarized_conversation: A 2-year-old child frequently avoids eye contact and has not started talking yet. The child does not follow instructions well; for example, they do not build a stack of blocks when asked. They continually open and close their mother's purse and do not play with toys in typical ways, as evidenced by not building a stack of 2 blocks when instructed during an examination. There is also a noted delay in social interaction; the child has no friends at daycare and avoids eye contact. Additionally, the child had not begun talking by their last well-child visit 9 months ago.
